intro: Croton aigburtensis, commonly known as the African croton, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, characterized by its milky sap and diverse leaf shapes. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are usually alternate, simple, and vary in shape from ovate to elliptic. The flowers are small and clustered, often surrounded by colorful bracts that attract pollinators.
